TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintPreviewDialog extends System.Windows.Forms.Form

Docs.summary: Represents a dialog box form that contains a for printing from a Windows Forms application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of the PrintPreviewDialog class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview. If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the PrintPreviewDialog setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.UseAntiAlias%2A> properties. The example assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `TreeView1` that contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> objects. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Tag%2A> property of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> object must be set to a fully qualified document name that can be accessed by the machine running the example. Set each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a string that identifies the file specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. For example, you could set `TreeNode1.Tag` to "c:\myDocuments\recipe.doc" and `TreeNode1.Text` to "recipe.doc". The example also assumes the form contains a PrintPreviewDialog named `PrintPreviewDialog1` and a button named `Button1`. To run this example, call the `InitializePrintPreviewDialog` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.p_17_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.p_17_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.p_17_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> property is initialized to `null`. You can change the value for this property at run time.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.UseAntiAlias%2A> properties. The example assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `TreeView1` that contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> objects. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Tag%2A> property of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> object must be set to a fully qualified document name that can be accessed by the machine running the example. Set each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a string that identifies the file specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. For example, you could set `TreeNode1.Tag` to "c:\myDocuments\recipe.doc" and `TreeNode1.Text` to "recipe.doc". The example also assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> named `PrintPreviewDialog1` and a button named `Button1`. To run this example, call the `InitializePrintPreviewDialog` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.windows.forms.p_5_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.windows.forms.p_5_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.windows.forms.p_5_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the button on the form that is clicked when the user presses the ENTER key.
Docs.value: An that represents the button to use as the accept button for the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
This property allows you to designate a default action that occurs when the user presses the ENTER key in your application. The button assigned to this property must be an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IButtonControl> that is on the current form or located within a container on the current form.
You can use this property, for example, to allow the user to quickly navigate a simple form by allowing them to press the ENTER key when they are finished instead of manually clicking the accept button with their mouse.
The accept button might not be activated if the currently selected control on the form intercepts the ENTER key and processes it. For example, a multiline text box control allows the ENTER key to be pressed when it is selected to insert a new line character in the control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form adjusts its size to fit the height of the font used on the form and scales its controls.
Docs.value: if the form will automatically scale itself and its controls based on the current font assigned to the form; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this property to allow your form and its controls to automatically adjust based on changes in the font. This can be useful in applications where the font might increase or decrease based on the language specified for use by Windows.
To obtain the size the form will auto scale to, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AutoScaleBaseSize%2A> property. If you want to determine the size the form will auto scale to based on a specific font, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.GetAutoScaleSize%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Size AutoScaleBaseSize { get; set; }

Docs.value: A that represents the height and width, in pixels, of the auto-scroll margin.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
The auto-scroll margin is used to determine the distance from the edges of the scrollable control. If the distance from the edge of a child control to parent-scrollable control is less than the value assigned to this property, the appropriate scroll bar is displayed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the automatic scroll bars.
Docs.value: A that represents the minimum height and width, in pixels, of the scroll bars.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The AutoScrollMinSize property is used to manage the screen size allocated to the automatic scroll bars.

Docs.value: if the form displays a control box in the upper-left corner of the form; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the ControlBox property is set to `true`, the control box is displayed in the upper-left corner of the caption bar. The control box is where the user can click to access the system menu.
> [!NOTE] > If your form does not display a control box, the form is not able to close using the ALT+F4 keyboard combination.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the border style of the form.
Docs.value: A that represents the style of border to display for the form. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
The border style of the form determines how the outer edge of the form appears. In addition to changing the border display for a form, certain border styles prevent the form from being sized. For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName> border style changes the border of the form to that of a dialog box and prevents the form from being resized. The border style can also affect the size or availability of the caption bar section of a form.

Docs.exception: The value specified is outside the range of valid values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a **Help** button should be displayed in the caption box of the form.
Docs.value: to display a **Help** button in the form's caption bar; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
When this property is set to `true`, a small button with a question mark appears in the caption bar to the left of the **Close** button. You can use this button to display Help for your application. You can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.HelpRequested> event of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class to display Help information to the user when the **Help** button of the form is clicked.
The value of the HelpButton property is ignored if the maximize or minimize boxes are shown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the icon for the form.
Docs.value: An that represents the icon for the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
A form's icon designates the picture that represents the form in the taskbar, as well as the icon that is displayed for the control box of the form.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.exception: The assigned value is not one of the enumeration values.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ImeMode%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form is a container for multiple document interface (MDI) child forms.
Docs.value: if the form is a container for MDI child forms; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
This property changes the display and behavior of the form to an MDI parent form. When this property is set to `true`, the form displays a sunken client area with a raised border. All MDI child forms assigned to the parent form are displayed within its client area.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form will receive key events before the event is passed to the control that has focus.
Docs.value: if the form will receive all key events; if the currently selected control on the form receives key events. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
When this property is set to `true`, the form will receive all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp> events. After the form's event handlers have completed processing the keystroke, the keystroke is then assigned to the control with focus.
You can use this property to process all keystrokes in your application and either handle the keystroke or call the appropriate control to handle the keystroke. For example, when an application uses function keys, you might want to process the keystrokes at the form level rather than writing code for each control that might receive keystroke events.
> [!NOTE] > If a form has no visible or enabled controls, it automatically receives all keyboard events.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the control relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
Docs.value: The that represents the upper-left corner of the control relative to the upper-left corner of its container.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Location%2A> property changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the margins for the control.
Docs.value: A representing the space between controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Margin%2A> property changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the maximize button is displayed in the caption bar of the form.
Docs.value: to display a maximize button for the form; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
A maximize button enables users to enlarge a window to full-screen size. To display a maximize button, you must also set the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> property to either <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.
A maximize button automatically becomes a restore button when a window is maximized. Minimizing or restoring a window automatically changes the restore button back to a maximize button.
> [!NOTE] > Maximizing a form at run time generates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property reflects the current state of the window. If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState>, the form is maximized independently of whatever settings are in effect for the MaximizeBox and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> properties

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size the form can be resized to.
Docs.value: A that represents the maximum size for the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
This property enables you to limit the size of a form to a specified maximum size. You can use this feature when displaying multiple windows at the same time to ensure that a single window does not cause other windows to be hidden.

Docs.exception: The values of the height or width within the are less than 0.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MaximumSize%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that is displayed in the form.
Docs.value: A that represents the menu to display in the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
You can use this property to switch between complete menu sets at run time. For example, you can define one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> to be displayed when your multiple document interface (MDI) form has no active MDI child forms and another <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> to display when a child window is displayed. You can also use a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> when specific conditions that require displaying a different menu set exist in your application.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the minimize button is displayed in the caption bar of the form.
Docs.value: to display a minimize button for the form; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
A minimize button enables users to minimize a window to an icon. To display a minimize button, you must also set the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> property to either <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.
> [!NOTE] > Minimizing a form at run time generates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property reflects the current state of the window. If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState?displayProperty=fullName>, the form is minimized independently of whatever settings are in effect for the MinimizeBox and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum size the form can be resized to.
Docs.value: A that represents the minimum size for the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
This property enables you to limit the size of a form to a specified minimum size. You can use this feature to prevent a user from sizing a window to an undesirable size.

Docs.exception: The values of the height or width within the are less than 0.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MinimumSize%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnClosing(class System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: Provides data for a cancelable event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not relevant for this class.
The OnClosing method invalidates the preview so it is regenerated when the dialog is reopened.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnClosing method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the opacity level of the form.
Docs.value: The level of opacity for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> class does not use the Opacity property.

Docs.value: A representing the control's internal spacing characteristics.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Padding%2A> property changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the contained in this form.
Docs.value: The contained in this form.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool ProcessDialogKey(valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether a key should be processed further.
Docs.returns: to indicate the key should be processed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName> key values will return `false`; otherwise, processing is passed to the base class's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.ProcessDialogKey%2A> method.

Docs.permission: for specifying the type of windows allowed. Associated enumeration

Docs.returns: to indicate the TAB key was successfully processed; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft RightToLeft { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeft%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool RightToLeftLayout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should be laid out from right to left.
Docs.value: to indicate the contents should be laid out from right to left; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
The RightToLeftLayout property is used for applications where the language is written from right to left. When both the RightToLeftLayout and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeft%2A> properties are `true`, mirroring will be turned on for the dialog box, and control placement and text will be from right to left.

Docs.summary: Occurs when value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeftLayout%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form is displayed in the Windows taskbar.
Docs.value: to display the form in the Windows taskbar at run time; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
If a form is a child of another form, the child form is not displayed in the Windows taskbar.
You can use this property to prevent users from selecting your form through the Windows taskbar. For example, if you display a **Find and Replace** tool window in your application, you might want to prevent that window from being selected through the Windows taskbar, since you would need both the application's main window and the **Find and Replace** tool window displayed in order to process searches appropriately.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the form.
Docs.value: A that represents the size of the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
This property allows you to set both the height and width of the form at the same time instead of setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> properties individually. If you want to set the size and location of a form, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.DesktopBounds%2A> property to size and locate the form based on desktop coordinates or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Bounds%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class to set the size and location of the form based on screen coordinates.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Size%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style of the size grip to display in the lower-right corner of the form.
Docs.value: Gets or sets the style of the size grip to display in the lower-right corner of the form.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the starting position of the dialog box at run time.
Docs.value: A that represents the starting position of the dialog box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables you to set the starting position of the form when it is displayed at run time. The form can be displayed manually or in the default location specified by Windows. You can also position the form to display in the center of the screen or in the center of its parent form for forms such as multiple document interface (MDI) child forms.

Docs.exception: The value specified is outside the range of valid values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key.
Docs.value: if the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
When the user presses the TAB key, the input focus is set to the next control in the tab order. Controls with the TabStop property value of `false` are not included in the collection of controls in the tab order. The tab order can be manipulated by setting the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TabIndex%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.TabStop%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the control.
Docs.value: An object that contains data about the control. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
Retrieves or assigns the data currently associated with the tree node. Any object-derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form should be displayed as the topmost form of your application.
Docs.value: to display the form as a topmost form; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
A topmost form is a form that overlaps all the other forms even if it is not the active or foreground form. Topmost forms are always displayed at the highest point in the z-order of an application. You can use this method to create a form that is always displayed in your application, such as a **Find and Replace** tool window.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the color that will represent transparent areas of the form.
Docs.value: A that represents the color to display transparently on the form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property is assigned a <xref:System.Drawing.Color>, the areas of the form that have the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> will be displayed transparently. Any mouse actions, such as the click of the mouse, that are performed on the transparent areas of the form will be transferred to the windows below the transparent area. For example, if the client region of a form is made transparent, clicking the mouse on that area will send the event notification of the click to any window that is below it. If the color assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property is the same as any controls on the form, they also will be displayed transparently. For example, if you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control on a form that has its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.Control%2A>, the control will be displayed transparently unless the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control is changed to a different color.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether printing uses the anti-aliasing features of the operating system.
Docs.value: if anti-aliasing is used; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.
The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> and UseAntiAlias properties. The example assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `TreeView1` that contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> objects. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Tag%2A> property of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> object must be set to a fully qualified document name that can be accessed by the machine running the example. Set each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a string that identifies the file specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. For example, you could set `TreeNode1.Tag` to "c:\myDocuments\recipe.doc" and `TreeNode1.Text` to "recipe.doc". The example also assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> named `PrintPreviewDialog1` and a button named `Button1`. To run this example, call the `InitializePrintPreviewDialog` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.p_16_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.p_16_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.p_16_1.vb)]

Docs.value: to use the wait cursor for the current control and all child controls; otherwise, . The default is .

if the control is visible; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the form's window state.
Docs.value: A that represents the window state of the form. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Before a form is displayed, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.WindowState%2A> property is always set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState?displayProperty=fullName>, regardless of its initial setting. This is reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Top%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> property settings. If a form is hidden after it has been shown, these properties reflect the previous state until the form is shown again, regardless of any changes made to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.WindowState%2A> property.

Docs.exception: The value specified is outside the range of valid values.
